image.altText: Wine and cheese platter

props.synopsis: Ever tried shipping something between Tasmania and the mainland? The hefty cost is supposed to be equal to driving goods down a highway, but the 'clunky' old federal scheme designed to ensure that hasn't been working for a while.

title.children: Why these luxury Tasmanian goods are costing more than they are meant to

image.altText: Right side profile of a female tuba player.

props.synopsis: As a kid, Rachel Kelly saw "all the other girls play the flute" but after battling to make a decent sound on that, turned to the tuba â€” and now is doing what no other woman has done before.

title.children: Rachel may not one to blow her own horn, but others happy to celebrate orchestra's milestone

image.altText: Spirit of Tasmania IV ship in port.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's government has paid for double-page ads across three newspapers to address "frequently asked questions" about why the Spirit of Tasmania ferries are still a long way off operating â€” with Labor saying the ads are a "blatant waste" of money.

title.children: 'Blatant waste': Critics lash double-page ads explaining ferry debacle

image.altText: Protesters at an anti-salmon farming rally on a beach.

props.synopsis: A Coalition government would not ban salmon farming in Tasmania's Macquarie Harbour even if the Maugean skate's threatened species' status is upgraded to "critically endangered", Peter Dutton says, as people take to the water in protest at the industry.

title.children: Dutton backs salmon farming even if threatened species status worsens

image.altText: Macaque monkeys.

props.synopsis: A visit to the 'monkey park' has been a part of this Tasmanian city's appeal since the late 1800s, so what is the history of Launceston's Monkey Island? And does it have a future?

title.children: How Launceston got its monkeys â€” and why they could be gone within decades

image.altText: A sepia photograph of Amy Sherwin, who is side on to the camera, in 1887

props.synopsis: Known as the "Tasmanian nightingale", Amy Sherwin was Australia's first international opera singer. Today, she is relatively unknown, but there is a push to change that.

title.children: Australia's first big opera star sang for kings and died penniless

image.altText: Bauble in a celery top pine tree.

props.synopsis: A tree is central to many Christmas celebrations, but it doesn't have to be a one-hit-wonder dragged from storage each year or even one that is cut and then recycled after use. A botanist shares her tips on using potted native species.

title.children: Did you miss? ðŸ“£ Native species that fit the bill for a perfect Christmas tree alternative

image.altText: Australia cricketers Alex Carey, Marnus Labuschagne and Steve Smith smile at the Adelaide Oval during a Test against India.

props.synopsis: A 10-wicket win is one hell of a way to respond to defeat in the first Test for Australia, but while victory in Adelaide doesn't solve all of the home side's problems it does set us up for a captivating series.

title.children: Australia answers some, but not all of its questions in Adelaide romp

image.altText: A person wearing a hoodie and medical mask peering through the window from the back seat of a taxi.

props.synopsis: The pictures were released as the FBI offered a $US50,000 reward for information into the case.

title.children: New pictures released of suspect in UnitedHealthcare CEO shooting

image.altText: A toddler is crying amid piles of debris in the aftermath of Cyclone Tracy in Darwin.

props.synopsis: Fifty years ago, Cyclone Tracy changed the lives of those who lived through it. But it has also fundamentally changed the rule book to building in Australia.

title.children: Nails and screws played central part in Darwin's undoing during Tracy

image.altText: A crowd of people gathered at a vigil in a park during the daytime.

props.synopsis: Members of Melbourne's Jewish community have gathered for a vigil near the synagogue which was targeted by arsonists on Friday. The vigil comes ahead of a meeting of counter-terrorism police investigating the blaze.

title.children: Jewish community gathers in show of support after synagogue fire

image.altText: A large crowd , some waving Israeli flags, converge around PM Anthony Albanese, who holds a lantern.

props.synopsis: Ahead of law enforcement groups meeting tomorrow to discuss the arson attack at Ripponlea's Adass Israel synagogue, the prime minister says in his view it was an act of terrorism.Â

title.children: Albanese says Melbourne synagogue attack 'quite clearly' terrorism

image.altText: Two trains at a train station.

props.synopsis: Transport authorities say NSW rail commuters are still likely to face some disruption on Monday, with delayed and cancelled services already locked in across the network despite the injunction.

title.children: Sydney train delays likely despite injunction blocking industrial action

image.altText: The Real Estate Institute of Queensland predicts more people will move to the Gold Coast once the health crisis is over

props.synopsis: Gold Coast property prices have outpaced every Australian capital city over the past five years.Â

title.children: Gold Coast outpaces Australian capital city home price growth

image.altText: Peter Dutton wearing high vis and touring a brick factory

props.synopsis: The opposition leader said the Coalition would decide its plans for net migration after the election, contradicting a promise in May to nearly halve the intake.

title.children: Dutton walks back promise to cut net migration

image.altText: Ellyse Perry of Australia celebrates a century, raising her bat and helmet to the crowd

props.synopsis: A record-breaking knock by Ellyse Perry and Georgia Voll's maiden international hundred have lifted Australia to a comprehensive 122-run victory over India in the second women's ODI in Brisbane.

title.children: Perry breaks records as Australia wins series over India

image.altText: Oscar Piastri in his McLaren F1 car, facing the opposite direction to the race circuit after spinning

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri's hopes of claiming a third race win in 2024 came unstuck on the first lap after being hit by Formula 1 world champion Max Verstappen.

title.children: Piastri taken out by Verstappen as McLaren win world title

image.altText: A crowd of people walking along a street in a central business district in Melbourne on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: The "mismatch" when it comes to entry-level jobs locks more people into relying on income support long-term, says the Australian Council of Social Service.

title.children: 'Punishingly low' support for jobless Australians amid work shortages

image.altText: Young woman in jeans and black tee holding a camera, standing in a park

props.synopsis: Rachael Burns is a 22-year-old Boorloo (Perth) woman with lived experience of neurodiversity and mental ill-health. She wants people to better understand what life for neurodivergent people is like.

title.children: I live in a world not built for me, here is what I have learned

image.altText: Man standing with luxury car inside penthouse

props.synopsis: Melbourne businessman Adrian Portelli and his company Xclusive Tech Pty Ltd have been charged with multiple counts of conducting an unlawful lottery between 2023 and 2024 in South Australia.

title.children: Who is 'Lambo Guy' and why is he accused of conducting an unlawful lottery?

image.altText: A protester holds a placard during a rally.

props.synopsis: Protesters say they are angry and devastated as South Korea's parliament fails to pass a motion to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol over martial law declaration.Â

title.children: Public outrage in South Korea as impeachment fails after vote boycott

image.altText: An aerial view shows a West Bank Jewish settlement surrounded by bare mountains.

props.synopsis: Australia's stance against Israel's "unlawful" settlements in the Occupied Palestinian Territories is likely to impact the Future Fund's investments in business enterprises operating there.

title.children: Australia's opposition to Israel's 'unlawful' settlements set to impact Future Fund

image.altText: A map of Australia.

props.synopsis: As climate change progresses, the CSIRO has created the first detailed national maps to help Australians understand the future risk to their properties.

title.children: These maps reveal Australia's potential bushfire future for every postcode

image.altText: Pat Cummins high-fives Travis Head as he runs through in celebration

props.synopsis: Australia levels its five-match series against India with a comprehensive win in Adelaide as Pat Cummins finishes with a five-wicket haul in the second innings.

title.children: 'This is back to how we want to play': Pat Cummins leads by example as Australia completes convincing victory in Adelaide

image.altText: A man's hand drops a bottle containing a sperm into a woman's hand.

props.synopsis: Those powering Facebook's sperm exchange say they want options and they want control. But in this unregulated space, it's not always clear who's in control and who isn't.

title.children: Craig used Facebook to make a baby with strangers, then came torment

image.altText: Australian teenage sprinter Gout Gout skips over the finish line well ahead of his rivals in a race.

props.synopsis: The family of Australian Olympian Peter Norman share their joy over Gout Gout's under-18 200m run at the Australian schools titles that broke Norman's famous record.

title.children: Peter Norman's family congratulates Gout Gout on record-breaking 200m

image.altText: View over Bendigo, Victorial

props.synopsis: Police charge a man with murder after an altercation allegedly took place between two men known to each other at a motel in Kangaroo Flat near Bendigo on Saturday

title.children: Man charged with murder following alleged fatal stabbing near Bendigo

image.altText: the new south wales premier chris minns stands at a lecturn at a press conference

props.synopsis: The announcement comes after a protest outside Sydney's Great Synagogue during an event on behalf of Israel's Technion University, which forced the venue to be locked down.

title.children: Minns government vows 'urgent' law reform to ban protests outside places of worship

image.altText: The Notre Dame at dusk, with a projection on the side lighting it up in neon green, pink and light blue.

props.synopsis: The 860-year-old cathedral has been meticulously restored and reopened with a red carpet ceremony to the sound of the landmark's historic bells.

title.children: Notre Dame reopens with star-studded ceremony

image.altText: Man putting food waste into a stainless steel drum

props.synopsis: Australia means so much to Iranian-born biotechnologist Sam Jahangard, he has made a huge sacrifice to keep his developments in the country instead of selling them internationally.

title.children: Scientist turns down $500 million to keep waste-to-compost invention in Australia

image.altText: Liam Paro throws a punch during his IBF super lightweight world title bout against Richardson Hitchins.

props.synopsis: Despite making a bright start, Liam Paro hands over his IBF super lightweight belt following a split-decision defeat to Richardson Hitchins in Puerto Rico.

title.children: Aussie Paro defeated in world title bout

image.altText: The remains of a car wreck on the side of a country road.

props.synopsis: West Australian Premier Roger Cook is pleading for drivers to do everything they can to keep themselves and others safe after seven fatalities on state roads this weekend.

title.children: WA edges closer to highest road toll in years after seven fatalities in single weekend

image.altText: Sharn Freier poses for a selfie with some Matildas fans in Geelong.

props.synopsis: Sharn Freier was at a concert during the Matildas' dramatic penalty shootout win over France at last year's Women's World Cup. However she has since emerged as an outstanding prospect for the the team.

title.children: Matildas revelation Freier embraces her rapid rise

image.altText: A long exposure shows a nuclear plant illuminated at night, with a white cloud of steam emerging from the top of two reactors.

props.synopsis: Amid a fierce political debate over energy policy, the Labor-led nuclear inquiry was seen as a tactic to discredit the Coalition's policy and stir up opposition in the regional communities where it wants to build reactors. But after weeks of public hearings, the Opposition is making the most of the opportunity to spruik its plans.Â

title.children: Labor's nuclear inquiry either a 'political stitch-up' or 'own goal'

image.altText: A man stands in a backyard with his arms crossed, looking into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Gambling reform advocates say greater action is needed to crack down on offshore gambling operators who are illegally targeting Australians, including recovered addicts.

title.children: Gambling companies accused of using 'loser lists' to target addicts
